--- title: Solar keywords: fastai sidebar: home_sidebar summary: "Access data and analysis services that provide access to solar resource data and NREL models using a python API." description: "Access data and analysis services that provide access to solar resource data and NREL models using a python API." nb_path: "00_solar.ipynb" ---
{% raw %}
{% endraw %}

SolarResourceData

Returns various types of solar data for a location. The service from NREL currently returns data for average Direct Normal Irradiance, average Global Horizontal Irradiance, and average Tilt at Latitude.

The location can be specified using latitude, longitude or an address.

{% raw %}

class SolarResourceData[source]

SolarResourceData(api_key, lat=None, lon=None, address=None, output_format='json')

Returns various types of solar data for a location. The service from NREL currently returns data for average Direct Normal Irradiance, average Global Horizontal Irradiance, and average Tilt at Latitude. The data outout format can be json or xml

{% endraw %} {% raw %}
{% endraw %}

An example to get solar resource data from NREL

In order to use the NREL developer API, you will need an API key from NREL. You can get one here. The process is simple and only requires your name and email where you will receive the API key.

{% raw %} 
NREL_API_KEY = "DEMO_KEY"

solar_resource_data = SolarResourceData(api_key=NREL_API_KEY, lat=40, lon=-105, output_format="json")

solar_resource_data.get()
